data.title: The Rockefeller University
data.text:
Charles M. Rice

2020 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

Rice received the 2020 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for research that led to a cure for hepatitis C, a viral disease affecting 170 million people worldwide.

Michael W. Young

2017 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

Young used genetics to identify mutations that disrupt the ability of the fruit fly to appropriately modulate its internal clock in response to a changing environment.

Roderick MacKinnon

2003 Nobel Prize in Chemistry

MacKinnonâ€™s discoveries offered insight into a variety of disorders caused by abnormalities in ion channel function, including epilepsy, ataxia, migraines and other electrical signaling diseases.

Paul Nurse

2001 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

Through studies of yeast, Nurse was able to show that a special gene plays a decisive role in several of the cell cycle's phases. In 1987, he identified a corresponding human gene.
